title: January 28, 2026, SHFE Aluminum Prices Experienced a Sudden Surge [SMM Analysis]
summary: SHFE aluminum prices surged suddenly on January 28, 2026, according to SMM analysis. This movement reflects volatility in the Chinese futures market amid broader aluminum trends. The surge comes after recent fluctuations in spot and futures pricing.

title: January 28 SMM Cast Aluminum Alloy Morning Comment: Futures Stabilize, Spot Premiums Widen
summary: Overnight aluminum alloy futures surged to 23,230 yuan/mt before stabilizing around 23,060 yuan/mt, up slightly. Spot premiums for ADC12 widened to 1,100 yuan/mt, while aluminum scrap prices followed primary aluminum declines. Downstream demand remains sluggish due to high prices and pre-holiday factors, with supply disruptions from weather and regulations.

title: Goldman Sachs lifts first-half 2026 aluminum price forecast, adjusts surplus outlook
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its first-half 2026 LME aluminum price forecast to $3,150 per tonne from $2,575. The adjustment reflects revised expectations for market surplus. This bullish outlook signals anticipated tighter supply-demand balance.

title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
summary: US aluminum prices exceeded $5,000 per tonne due to escalating tariffs up to 50%, falling imports, and low stocks. Premiums over LME prices reached 68%, driven by factors like EU sanctions on Russian aluminum and China's production cap. Europe's CBAM adds further cost pressures on high-carbon imports.

title: Week-in-Review and Thoughts for the Upcoming Week of 01/26/2026
summary: The US Midwest aluminum premium hit a record above $1 per pound, comprising nearly 70% of the LME cash price. LME aluminum rose 1.1% weekly amid strong base metals performance. Upcoming data includes US jobless claims, trade deficit, and factory orders.

title: EGA and Century Aluminium set to build first new US smelter in nearly 50 years
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium and Century Aluminum have partnered to build the first new primary aluminum smelter in the U.S. since 1980 in Inola, Oklahoma, with a capacity of 750,000 tonnes per year. The project will create over 1,000 permanent jobs and 4,000 construction jobs, with construction expected to begin by late 2026 and production targeted for the end of the decade.

title: Major Aluminum Project in Oklahoma Promises Thousands of Jobs
summary: A joint venture between Emirates Global Aluminium and Century Aluminum will develop the first new primary aluminum smelter in the U.S. in nearly five decades at Inola, with an annual production capacity of 750,000 metric tons. The facility will use EGA's advanced smelting technology and is expected to become the largest primary aluminum smelter in the country once operational.

title: Hindalco unveils $2.3 billion aluminum smelter expansion plan
summary: Hindalco Industries announced a $2.29 billion project to expand its aluminum smelter in Odisha, India, as part of efforts to reduce import reliance. The expansion is expected to generate over 15,000 additional jobs and nearly halve India's dependence on imported flat-rolled aluminum.

title: Century Aluminum joins Oklahoma smelter
summary: Century Aluminum has joined the Oklahoma smelter project partnership, with construction expected to begin by the end of 2026 and initial production targeted thereafter.

title: Aluminium Giants Hit Major Milestone with Low-Carbon Production
summary: Montreal-based Elysis, a joint venture of Alcoa and Rio Tinto, achieved a breakthrough by installing its carbon-free inert anode technology in a 450-kA cell, scaling up from a 100-kA pilot that supplied low-carbon aluminum for products like Apple devices and Audi wheels. The technology uses inert metallic alloys or ceramics to eliminate CO2 and PFC emissions during smelting, with a vertical design extending anode lifespan and potentially reducing costs. This milestone positions aluminum production to compete in a carbon-conscious economy amid concerns over U.S. funding cuts for decarbonization.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) is showcasing innovations like robotics, AI, deposit return systems, and home recycling equipment at Climate Week NYC to achieve 100% aluminum can recycling by 2050 and 80% by 2030. These technologies aim to recover aluminum from municipal waste and enable household closed-loop recycling, boosting circularity even in regions with limited government support. Industry leaders highlight aluminum's potential for decarbonization through enhanced recycling compared to glass or plastic.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: The ALUMINIUM 2026 trade fair will center on sustainability, emphasizing secondary aluminum for decarbonization, alongside topics like recycling, primary production, and applications in mobility and construction. Supported by Aluminium Deutschland and European Aluminium, it serves as a platform for collaboration, innovation, and showcasing the industry's recyclability to address global challenges. Organizers aim to highlight technological advancements and future potential in a sustainable aluminum sector.

title: AKFA Aluminum to Build First U.S. Facility in Kentucky
summary: AKFA Aluminum Solutions is investing $80 million in its first U.S. manufacturing facility in Kentucky, creating 331 jobs with a focus on sustainable production using recycled aluminum billets and energy-efficient equipment for a lower-carbon supply chain. The full-cycle hub will produce up to 100,000 tons annually for construction, transportation, and renewable energy markets, strengthening U.S.-Uzbekistan trade ties. This aligns with Kentucky's manufacturing growth in advanced materials and electrification.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers for Groundbreaking Clean Backup Energy Initiative in Data Centers
summary: Phinergy's aluminum-air long-duration generation technology was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers from over 70 proposals as a clean backup energy solution to replace diesel generators. The hub, including members like Google, Microsoft, and Schneider Electric, will collaborate with Phinergy to scale the technology to MW levels and deploy it in live data center environments. This supports the transition to net-zero operations in digital infrastructure.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 962.05 USD/T on January 28, 2026, down 0.31% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 2.56%, and year-over-year they are up significantly. Forecasts indicate trading at 958.30 USD/T by quarter-end and 1034.13 in 12 months.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Nucor, the largest U.S. steel producer, kept hot-rolled coil prices stable in late December 2025 after nine weeks of increases, providing temporary market stability. China implemented a steel export licensing framework on January 1, 2026, for about 300 products, expected to have marginal impact. Indian steelmakers' shares rose 5% after imposing tariffs on cheap steel imports from China.

title: Commodity Price Watch: January 2026
summary: US sheet steel prices continue upward due to inventory restocking, though underlying demand shows no improvement; momentum is expected to falter by late Q1 or early Q2. Globally, steel prices are flat to slightly upward in 2026 amid trade barriers and protectionism, with limited room for significant rises or declines. European sheet faces similar spike-relapse dynamics.

title: Steel Prices in the Fourth Week of January 2026
summary: In the flat steel segment, Russian hot-rolled coil prices (FOB) remained stable at $445–450 per ton. Cold-rolled coils (1 mm) from Russia also held steady. This reflects ongoing price stability in key export markets during the fourth week of January.

title: AISI: Raw steel production jumps to 20-week high
summary: US raw steel production reached 1,778,000 short tons in the week ending January 24, 2026, marking the highest rate in over four months with a 1.3% week-over-week increase. The mill capability utilization rate stood at 76.9%, up from 75.9% the previous week and 76.3% year-over-year. Year-to-date production through January 24 totaled 6,016,000 short tons, up 3.4% compared to the same period last year.

title: AISI: US Steel Production Up 4.6% Year-on-Year in Late January
summary: US raw steel production rose to 1,778,000 net tons in the week ending January 24, 2026, representing a 4.6% year-over-year increase from 1,700,000 net tons in the same week of 2025. The capability utilization rate reached 76.9%, up from 76.3% a year prior, with regional production showing broad-based strength across all major US steelmaking hubs.

title: Steel Falls as China Output Declines
summary: Steel rebar futures fell toward 3,100 CNY per ton after China's official data showed steel production sank to a seven-year low in 2025, dropping 4.4% to 961 million tons. Weak domestic demand in the property sector and government restrictions on new capacity are contributing to the decline, though China Iron & Steel Association data showed member mills lifted daily output to nearly 2 million tons in early January.

title: Steeled for Transition: A Deep-Dive Analysis of Steel Dynamics (STLD)
summary: Steel Dynamics (STLD) is diversifying into higher-margin products like painted steels and recycled aluminum to reduce sensitivity to steel price cycles and meet demand for sustainable materials. The company leads in 'Green Steel' with EAF technology achieving 75% lower carbon intensity than blast furnaces, certified by the Global Steel Climate Council in July 2025. Innovations include the energy-optimized Sinton mill and a $2.5 billion aluminum rolling mill applying scrap-based expertise for lower-emission production.

title: SSAB and Rheinmetall Sign Letter of Intent for Fossil-Free Steel Supply
summary: SSAB and German defense firm Rheinmetall have signed a letter of intent for supplying fossil-free steel, marking a key milestone in sustainable production. SSAB's new electric steel mill in Luleå has been designated a strategic net-zero project under the EU’s Net-Zero Industry Act. The company specializes in high-strength, sustainable steels like Strenx® and Hardox® aimed at creating a stronger, lighter, and fossil-free world.

title: Copper Holds Gains on Dollar Weakness
summary: Copper futures held around $5.94 per pound after rallying nearly 3% in the previous session, supported by a weaker US dollar that boosts demand for commodities priced in greenbacks. This makes copper more affordable for buyers using other currencies. The market shows ongoing strength amid broader metal demand trends.

title: Both bids and offers were scarce during the day, with weak supply and demand leading to a slight decline in the Yangshan premium
summary: Warrant prices for copper dropped slightly, with averages down $2/mt for QP February, amid scarce bids and offers. The LME contango widened as suppliers held back and downstream demand remained absent, leading to declining premiums for physical cargo. Transactions were limited, with small deals around $15-20/mt for early February delivery.

title: Copper, Gold, and Silver Take a Step Back
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the LME fell 0.68% to $13,109 due to profit-taking and higher SHFE margin requirements effective January 28, which curbed demand. Supply disruption concerns provide underlying support, alongside long-term demand from AI data centers and China's $574 billion power grid investment through 2030. SHFE also adjusted trading limits and curbed some client activities.

title: Copper Prices Decline Amid Demand Concerns
summary: Copper prices declined in Asian sessions due to a firmer US dollar and signs of weakening demand, particularly in China ahead of Lunar New Year with reduced consumer purchasing. SHFE raised margin requirements for copper from 10% to 11% to curb speculation, adding downward pressure. ANZ analysts noted decelerating Chinese economic activity and inventory buildup caution.

title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Jan. 28
summary: London Stock Exchange Group reported copper at 5.83 USD at 0200 GMT on January 28. This update includes prices for other metals like gold at 5,079.90 USD, iron ore at 106.03 USD, palladium at 1,967.50 USD, and platinum at 2,675.10 USD. The data reflects early morning global metals market snapshot.

title: Highland Copper Recaps 2025 Execution and Announces 2026 Work Plan to Advance Copperwood Toward Construction Decision
summary: Highland Copper announced its 2026 work plan to advance the Copperwood project toward a construction decision, including completion of FEED engineering and improved copper recoveries to 87.6% via ultrafine flotation technology. Contracts for tailings disposal and water balance engineering were awarded in 2025. The plan anticipates project financing, including $250 million from the US in 2027, and updates to mine design for potential cost reductions.

title: Freeport-McMoRan Boosts 2026, 2027 Capex, Advancing Copper Projects
summary: Freeport-McMoRan plans $4.3 billion in capex for 2026 and $4.5 billion for 2027, up from $3.9 billion in 2025, to advance copper projects and expand U.S. production by over 50% in the next four to five years. The company supplies 70% of U.S. refined copper and is investing in innovation and expanded facilities. This supports growing global copper demand from power grids, renewables, and electrification.

title: Turkey copper mine owners are said to hire Goldman for sale
summary: Owners of Turkey's largest open-pit copper mine, Gokirmak, hired Goldman Sachs to sell the business, seeking up to $1 billion for part or all of Acacia Mining Enterprises. The mine has 24 million tons of copper-ore reserves and produces 120,000 tons of concentrate annually. The sale follows record copper prices amid mine disruptions and strong demand from electrification.

title: MIGA Continues to Support Renewable Energy in Chile
summary: MIGA issued a second guarantee backing renewable energy purchases to support clean copper production by Corporación Nacional del Cobre de Chile (CODELCO), critical for the global energy transition. Chile's leadership in copper production is highlighted as vital beyond its borders. This aids financial inclusion and climate finance through BancoEstado.

title: Driving innovation at Escondida
summary: BHP highlights innovations at its Escondida copper mine in Chile, the world's largest producer, where the Escondida Norte pit is now fully autonomous with 33 trucks and 11 drills, contributing 30% of production and moving over 350,000 tonnes daily. These advancements enhance safety, efficiency, and sustainability amid rising global copper demand for electrification and renewables. Over 5,000 workers have been trained, with 64% female participation in autonomy roles.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services Collaborate on Nuton Technology
summary: Gunnison Copper partners with Rio Tinto's Nuton technology and AWS to produce low-carbon copper using less water and emissions compared to traditional methods, producing 99.99% pure cathode at the mine gate. The first Nuton copper from Johnson Camp will supply AWS U.S. data centers, strengthening supply chains and supporting decarbonization. This innovation shortens the supply chain and recovers value from waste materials.

title: Zijin Joins International Copper Association to Advance Sustainable Development
summary: Zijin Mining, the world's fourth-largest copper producer, joined the International Copper Association on January 1, 2026, via subsidiary Gold Mountains to promote responsible production, sustainability, and innovation. The membership fosters global collaboration to support copper's role in the energy transition and resilient supply chains. Zijin commits to green mining practices and industry dialogues.

title: Gold Mountains, subsidiary of Zijin Mining Group, Officially Joins the International Copper Association
summary: Gold Mountains, Zijin Mining's subsidiary, joins ICA to deepen sustainable collaboration across the copper value chain, leveraging strengths in resource development, innovation, and green operations. This step supports global energy transition amid rising demand, promoting technical exchange and responsible production. ICA welcomes Zijin's scale and capabilities for industry advancement.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS partner to deploy Nuton technology for low-carbon copper production at U.S. data centers, emphasizing industrial innovation and cloud analytics for cleaner materials. Nuton reduces water use and emissions, accelerating optimization and supporting net-zero goals. This collaboration enhances supply chain resilience for critical minerals.

title: Nickel Prices Rebound Sharply, May Enter High-Level ...
summary: Nickel prices have sustained a rebound, breaking above previous consolidation ranges with the main Shanghai nickel contract approaching 150,000 yuan per ton. Refined nickel shows a significant premium over nickel pig iron and sulfate, incentivizing increased production of high-grade nickel products in Indonesia. Even in a pessimistic scenario, the 2026 refined nickel surplus is expected to remain below 300,000 metric tons.

title: Nickel prices hit 15-month high on robust sentiment
summary: LME nickel prices reached $18,045/t on January 6, up 7% daily and exceeding $18,000/t for the first time in 15 months, driven by rising copper prices and geopolitical tensions. SHFE nickel prices hit their 8% daily limit amid strong sentiment, boosting downstream stainless steel prices. Market participants expect steady nickel prices in 2026 due to unchanged supply-demand fundamentals.

title: Nickel prices outlook remains bearish as UBS warns of persistent surplus
summary: UBS forecasts a persistent global nickel surplus through 2026 despite production cuts, as Indonesia continues adding capacity amid weak stainless steel and battery demand recovery. Supply adjustments like 250,000 tonnes of cuts are insufficient to rebalance the market, with surpluses adding to LME inventories. Demand growth is projected at 4-5% annually from 2025-2028.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices surged to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026, the highest in over two years, as Indonesia delays permits and cuts output quotas to support prices. Much of the prior surplus was a 'paper' illusion, with only 55% of approved capacity utilized in 2025. Prices could test $20,000–$22,000/t or even $25,000/t under tightening conditions.

title: Canada Nickel Revolutionises Zero-Carbon Production Through Advanced Mineralisation Technology
summary: Canada Nickel has achieved a breakthrough in zero-carbon nickel production using advanced mineralisation technology. This innovation aims to revolutionize sustainable nickel processing for battery applications. The development supports cleaner energy supply chains amid growing demand for low-emission metals.

title: Arca and Giga Metals sign exclusive agreement to explore carbon removal at B.C. nickel project
summary: Arca Climate Technologies and Giga Metals have signed an exclusive agreement to explore carbon removal integration at a British Columbia nickel project. This partnership focuses on enhancing sustainability through carbon sequestration in nickel mining operations. It represents a step toward net-zero emissions in critical mineral production.

title: Nickel and cobalt out, CO2 in at Turnagain
summary: A potential mine at the Turnagain project could sequester over 200 million tons of atmospheric CO2 while producing nickel and cobalt. This innovative approach replaces traditional tailings with carbon mineralization for permanent storage. It advances sustainable mining technology by turning waste into a climate solution.
